title: Object-oriented diagram plots with ggplot2
text: ggdiagram package takes object-oriented approach making diagrams (using S7) plots results using ggplot2. package preliminary state. structural beams bit plumbing yet capable fulfilling eventual purpose. motivation making ggdiagram find way approach functionality Tikz convenience, speed, flexibility R. ggdiagram package built top S7 ggplot2, making use ggarrow ggtext.

title: angle class — angle
text: Creates angle metric radians, degrees, turns.

title: angle class — angle
code: angle(.data = class_missing)  degree(degree = class_missing)  radian(radian = class_missing)  turn(turn = class_missing)

title: angle class — angle
text: .data real number indicating number turns. degree degrees radian radians turn proportion full turns circle (1 turn = 2 * pi radians)

title: angle class — angle
text: Angles turns can real number, degrees displayed values -360 +360, radians -2pi +2pi.

title: angle class — angle
code: # Three Different ways to make a right angle ## A quarter turn turn(.25) #> <turn> #> @ degree: num 90 #> @ radian: num 1.57 #> @ turn  : num 0.25  ## half pi radians radian(.5 * pi) #> <radian> #> @ degree: num 90 #> @ radian: num 1.57 #> @ turn  : num 0.25  ## 90 degrees degree(90) #> <degree> #> @ degree: num 90 #> @ radian: num 1.57 #> @ turn  : num 0.25  # Operations degree(30) + degree(20) #> <degree> #> @ degree: num 50 #> @ radian: num 0.873 #> @ turn  : num 0.139 degree(350) + degree(20) #> <degree> #> @ degree: num 10 #> @ radian: num 0.175 #> @ turn  : num 0.0278 degree(30) - degree(30) #> <degree> #> @ degree: num 0 #> @ radian: num 0 #> @ turn  : num 0 degree(30) - degree(50) #> <degree> #> @ degree: num -20 #> @ radian: num -0.349 #> @ turn  : num -0.0556  degree(30) * 2 #> <degree> #> @ degree: num 60 #> @ radian: num 1.05 #> @ turn  : num 0.167 degree(30) / 3 #> <degree> #> @ degree: num 10 #> @ radian: num 0.175 #> @ turn  : num 0.0278  radian(1) + 1 # added or subtracted numbers are radians #> <radian> #> @ degree: num 115 #> @ radian: num 2 #> @ turn  : num 0.318 degree(10) + 10 # added or subtracted numbers are degrees #> <degree> #> @ degree: num 20 #> @ radian: num 0.349 #> @ turn  : num 0.0556 turn(.25) + .25 # added or subtracted numbers are turns #> <turn> #> @ degree: num 180 #> @ radian: num 3.14 #> @ turn  : num 0.5  # Trigonometric functions work as normal sin(degree(30)) #> [1] 0.5 cos(degree(30)) #> [1] 0.8660254 tan(degree(30)) #> [1] 0.5773503

title: Probability rounding — round_probability
text: Rounds significant digits, removing leading zeros.

title: Probability rounding — round_probability
code: round_probability(   p,   accuracy = 0.01,   digits = NULL,   max_digits = NULL,   remove_leading_zero = TRUE,   round_zero_one = TRUE )

title: Probability rounding — round_probability
text: p probability accuracy smallest increment digits significant digits max_digits maximum rounding digits remove_leading_zero remove leading zero round_zero_one round 0 1
